Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the drive
The gravelled drive, before the steps leading into the mansion. A private limousine is parked here.

The drive is covered by fine, even gravel, marked with the tracks of heavy limousines. A flight of brick steps lead up towards the entry; at the foot of the steps is a parked limousine, its headlamps shining on the gravel and grass.
http://www.skotos.net/MansionGame/images/Drive.jpg
the front steps
A few wide steps of buff roman brick lead up towards the front of the mansion.
limousine's back door

The rear doors, right and left, of a limousine open into the passenger compartment. They are glossy, black steel, with chrome door handles and shiny aluminum-framed glass windows in their upper halves.
You enter the long, black limousine.
the gravelled drive
The drive is covered in fine, gray gravel, even except where heavy limousines have left their tracks.
the front lawn
Wide, green lawns stretch off into the darkness, away from the front of the house. The gravel drive crosses the lawn, ending in front of the steps.
limousine

The mansion and stars are reflected in the glossy black paint and the abundant chrome of the long limousine (technically, a town car) parked in the middle of the drive; the wide white sidewalls of the tires are equally visible, but not reflective. Chromed cowl headlights, spotlight, and horns are spaced around the tall radiator and front fenders; the headlights are casting long beams of light across the drive and lawn. The tall, chromed radiator in turn caps the six foot long bonnet over the engine. Five rectangular louvers line each side of the bonnet, ready to open and feed the mighty engine within. Spare tires are mounted on either side of the hood, above the long tails of the front fenders; the rear view mirrors are strapped onto the tops of the spare tires. The front windshield is divided into two raked segments. There are two doors on each side of the vehicle; the front doors open into the roofless driver's compartment, separated by a division window from the passenger compartment. The front and rear fenders are joined by a long, rubber-surfaced running board. Behind the passenger doors are quarter windows; a deep luggage compartment is built into the rear, with mounting brackets for an external trunk above the chromed rear bumper. Chromed and cowled tail lamps sit on the tapering ends of the rear fenders. The limousine is over eighteen feet long, with a twelve foot wheelbase.
A long, gleaming black limousine waits on the drive.
limousine's body

The limousine is built as a seven-passenger, four door vehicle, with a straight sill and the front drivers' compartment open to the sky. The rear doors open into the passenger compartment; there are quarter windows just behind the passenger doors, and a rear window in the back.
limousine's boot
At the rear of a limousine, below the back window, is a downward-opening hatch for the boot: a spacious luggage compartment.
limousine's front door
The front doors, right and left, of a limousine open into the roofless driver's compartment. They are glossy, black steel, with chrome door handles, and do not have windows.
limousine's front fender
The glossy black front fenders swoop back and down to join the running boards. A spotlight is mounted on each fender; a spare tire is mounted on the side of the bonnet, above the fender.
limousine's rear fender
The glossy black rear fenders swoop up from the running boards, over the tires, and then down again almost to the rear bumper. A tail lamp is mounted on the rearward slope of each fender.
limousine's front bumper
The front bumper is a double bar of gleaming, chromed steel mounted on the front of the suspension. The lights and horns are mounted above and behind it.
limousine's engine bonnet

A short cowl section joins the main body of the limousine with the long, glossy black engine bonnet. The bonnet's sides are vertical and flat; each side has five large vertical louver doors built into it. The hood is smoothly curved over the enormous engine. The forward end of the bonnet meets the broad chromed frame of the radiator.
limousine's twin horns
Two long, gleaming horns protrude forward from the cowling, below the main headlamps.
limousine's lights

Great cowl headlamps, thirteen inch bowls of chromed steel, cast their beams of pale light across the gravel and grass before the limousine. They are mounted on either side of the tall radiator, above the horns on a bar connecting the fenders. Mounted beside the headlights, on top of the fenders, are smaller spotlights. Brake lights are mounted on the rear fenders.
limousine's side mirror
A rear view mirror is strapped to the top of each spare tire. Leather straps hold the shiny aluminum bar and frame to the tire.
limousine's radiator

A tall, flat-fronted radiator caps the front of the bonnet, bracketed by the fenders. The wide chrome frame around the radiator is topped by the radiator cap, which bears a small statuette of beaver rushing forward at speed.
limousine's rear bumper
The rear bumper is a double bar of gleaming, chromed steel mounted on the rear of the frame. It supports brackets meant to carry a regular trunk (item of luggage) behind the boot luggage compartment.
limousine's roof
A limousine's glossy black roof only covers the passenger compartment; the driver's front seat is left open to the sky.
limousine's running board

Connecting the front and rear fenders on either side of a limousine are rubber-surfaced running boards, attached to the body just below the door sills. A chrome strip runs along the straight edge of the running board.
limousine's spare tire

The limousine's spare tires have glossy black steel discs connecting the hub and the rim. There are two spares, each mounted on the sides of the engine bonnet, with their lower tread supported in depressions within the front fenders. The sidewalls of the tires are spotlessly white; the hub is covered by a chrome hubcap. Strapped to the top of each spare tire is a rear view mirror.
limousine's wheel
The limousine's wheels are glossy black steel discs connecting the hub and the rim. The sidewalls of the 38 inch diameter tires are spotlessly white; the hub is covered by a chromed hubcap.
limousine's windows

A limousine has seven windows: the two-segment front windshield; the division window between the passenger compartment and the driver; the passenger door windows; the quarter windows behind the passenger door windows; and the rear window.
limousine's split windshield
The front windshield of a limousine is constructed in two segments, each raked back slightly from a central post. It is framed in shiny aluminum; the top of the frame carries two windshield wipers.
the view of the entry
Looking towards the vestibule, you see:
Looking towards the vestibule, you see:

Notes:Category.Notes:Note: The first real room of the mansion.
